API Docs for Sandy 3D Engine haXe Port, ver. 3.1.1

sandy.core.light.Light3D

type
class
extends
flash.events.EventDispatcher
version
3.1
The Light3D class is used for creating the light of the world.

The light in Sandy is a light source at infinity, emitting parallel colored light. The direction, color, and intensity of the light can be changes.

Static Variables

MAX_POWER(inline,null) : Float

Maximum value accepted. If the default value (150) seems too big or too small for you, you can change it. But be aware that the actual lighting calculations are normalised i.e. 0 -> MAX_POWER becomes 0 -> 1

Constructor

new()
parameters
p_oD The direction of the emitted light.
p_nPow Intensity of the emitted light.
see
sandy.core.data.Point3D
Creates a new light source.

Uneeded? setDirectionPoint3D() does the same thing...

setDirectionPoint3D(default,method) : pDir : sandy.core.data.Point3D -> Void

Sets the direction of the Light3D.

setPower(default,method) : p_nPow : Float -> Void

The the power of the light. A number between 0 and MAX_POWER is necessary. The highter the power of the light is, the less the shadows are visibles.
